title: Keller Independent School District - Cancellation of 'The Laramie Project'

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Keller Independent School District - Cancellation of 'The Laramie Project'
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records reflecting the reasons, rationale, or basis for the decision (by any of the "many stakeholders" referenced by Bryce Nieman's statement to the Dallas Morning News) to cancel the production of "The Laramie Project."

This request includes, but is not limited to:

(a) any emails, text messages, or other communications sent or from any of the "stakeholders" which references the play (whether by name or implication);
(b) any calendar entries or invitations concerning any meeting during which "The Laramie Project" was discussed; and
(c) any audio, video, or written recording of any meeting during which "The Laramie Project" was discussed, including any Zoom, Webex, or similar recording.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Sacramento Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Kalayanaprapruit

title: San Rafael PD

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation is available on VanessaHolton.com

In November of 2020 I filed a State Bar Complaint against the General Counsel of California, Vanessa Lynne Holton. She retaliated by filing a police report with the San Rafael Police Dept. She did so on California State Bar letterhead, signing the report as the General Counsel. 

This resulted in an Officer Bellamy leaving me two voice messages, one telling me to stop harassing Vanessa Holton, and to take down the website, a clear violation of my 1st  Amendment Right. The second call changed to charges of “identity theft,” and the “false impersonation of a person thru cyber means.” That is a clear threat of criminal charges and abuse of both police and governmental authority

Around March or April of 2021 I spoke twice with Officer Bellamy, hopefully recorded by the SRPD. In the first call he describes the report being on State Bar letterhead, signed by Vanessa Holton as the General Counsel. He explained he was unaware of the State Bar Complaint and apologized. Sadly though, he was unable to comprehend the identity theft statute. He seemed to think just calling myself Vanessa Holton was enough.

In the second call he becomes a little nastier, telling me he does not care about my religious views, and that the report was being closed. When I requested to speak with a senior officer, I later received a call from Lt. Bishop. He informed me that the report had been blacked out, the California State Bar letterhead, the title under her signature, any reference to the California State Bar, gone. 

On the website you will find two documents from the SRPD, one dated 17 Jan 2023, a FOIA response where the “victims” name was not released. My crime was building a website to harass and defame the victim, a public figure. 

I guess Vanessa Holton never watched Saturday Night Live. Date of the report was November 23, 2020

The second letter, dated November 9th, 2022, almost two years later, informs me that my FOIA was rejected as the report is still an “investigative report. This is in clear violation of both my 1st Amendment and 6th Amendment Rights. You can listen to the two recordings from Officer Bellamy there as well. (Video is AI enhanced for your enjoyment!)

The reason they kept the report open was to protect Vanessa Holton. (See letter from State Bar Office of Chief Trial Counsel by Special Deputy Rizamarie Gonzaga Sitton.) 

I am asking for a full and correct FOIA disclosure for #SR-20-07929 from the San Rafael Police Dept., with as unredacted a copy of the report filed by Vanessa Holton as allowed. 

I am also asking for four (4) audio recordings between my cellphone (818) 310-5073 and the San Rafael PD. The two with Officer Bellamy, the one with Lt. Bishop, and the one in January of 2023. The last call was where I was told the case was closed, no I could not file a false report complaint as “anyone can file a report.” 

I guess San Rafael PD is unaware of California Penal Code 148.5 PC. An audio copy is desired.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Robinson

title: CIA: Abasha Experiment

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA: Abasha Experiment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents generated by the Agency between the years 1971 and 1992 about the "Abasha Experiment" in the Georgian Soviet Socialist Republic. The "Abasha Experiment" or "Abasha agricultural experiment" or "Абашскому эксперимент" was an economic reform undertaken by then-First Secretary of the Georgian Communist Party Eduard Shevardnadze in 1971 in the rural agricultural community of Abasha. The economic experiment generated considerable news coverage at the time, and some academic study since. 

This is a request for all documents generated by the agency regarding what was either formally or colloquially known as the "Abasha Experiment" that began in 1971. Please exclude CIA-RDP86T00591R000100060004-4.pdf which includes a mention of the Abasha experiment, but that has already been released. Please include a search for coverage of the Abasha experiment in open-source collection of Soviet newspapers such as Sovetskaya Kultura and Sovetskaya Rossiya. Please include a search for documents created by the agency that contain the Cyrillic "Абашскому эксперимент." Please ensure that a search of documents created by the Office of Soviet Analysis that include Abasha Experiment is conducted. 

Please also include a search for any documents or reports labeled as "intelligence assessments" related to the Abasha experiment. 

Keywords for search: Abasha, Abasha agricultural experiment, Abasha market reform, Abasha and Shevardnadze,  Абашскому эксперимент

Thank you for your agency's commitment to transparency. The Abasha Experiment is a topic of common conversation in the country of Georgia, but finding English language information online regarding this project is difficult. The purpose of this request is to educate the public and provide access to this information to a wide audience.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: RN Scope of Practice Clarification Regarding Partial Administrations  & Conflicts in Clinical Judgment (Department of Health)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: RN Scope of Practice Clarification Regarding Partial Administrations  & Conflicts in Clinical Judgment (Department of Health)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

Within the time frame of 2019-2024, to be on the date this request is processed, I request the following according to the below criteria:

1. Any opinion issued that mentions or includes the keywords "partial administration" or "partial medication administration" either as a formal opinion or other formal document specific to Registered Nurses.
2. Any an email sent by the person or person(s) with the authority to opine and clarify nuances and specificity referring specifically to RN scope of practice such as by the DON, ADON, CNO (if an available position at your agency), or a similar high-ranking nursing professional of a different title OR non-nursing professional if such person(s) exist that can issue authoritative opinions on the matter, whichever appropriate person(s) exist within your agency. If specificity is required for this criterion, please refer to the keywords above. I'm aware of the ANA Scope of Practice and it does not opine on partial administrations with any degree of specificity or nuance.  I request emails where such person(s) are either sender, recipient, cc, or bcc, but please exclude baileypillon@gmail dot com as sender and/or recipient in the responsive records unless noted in a response (I apologize in advance) to this email.
3. Regarding (1) and (2), I request to know the specific contexts in which a partial medication administration is permissible, if at all, and if it is specific to the setting, if it is the case. If so, please specify what contexts it is permissible and when nursing judgment and critical thinking reasonably applies when considering the reasonable, prudent legal standard that RNs are held to.
4. The titles of the person(s) that typically work on EMR/EHRs and the percentage of those persons who are medical professionals that hold an active license from 2019-2024, if it is known to our agency. Please breakdown by year, if possible.
5. If there is a differentiation regarding partial administrations (assuming it is within scope at all) between RNs and LPNs and if it varies depending on the setting and/or context within this specific criterion (5).
6. If a partial medication administration is indeed within the scope of practice within RNs, I wish to know in what manner a healthcare facility may limit or entirely restrict partial administrations, if instructed nursing leadership or noted in the facility policies/procedures.
7. The precise policies/procedures taken by your agency in the event that legal action (in the form of a civil or criminal suit specifically by your agency) is taken against a licensed nursing or other medical professional, including the titles of the person(s) involved.
8. Any documents, if it is the case that a rare, one time partial administration is not within the scope of practice for RNs, that state the rationale as to why it is not within scope according to your agency.
9. Any documents or opinions issued by your agency that set forth an opinion, guidelines, or other type of document wherein there is a clinical disagreement between the RN and MD/DO/ARNP/PA regarding an order, according to clinical judgment, if it conflicts between the RN and provider.
10. Any documents wherein a non-nursing medical professional (specifically an MD/DO) can decide (and if it is legal) what is or isn't within the scope of practice for an RN, given that the provider is not an RN.

If responsive records for the above criteria exceed 200 records, please provide the number of responsive records by each criterion so that I can narrow the scope and/or time frame of this request. I sincerely appreciate it.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and such documents made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I grant permission for fees up to $50. If the fees are still in excess of $50, please let me know as well as the number of results produced and I will further revise the criteria. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days. Please provide an estimated completion date for the above responsive records.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon RN

communications.subject: Welcome to the Public Records Center!

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P113719-022624
communications.communication:
Dear Bailey Pillon : 
 
This email is to confirm receipt of your public records request. If this request requires extensive use of resources, this office will contact you again once an estimate of the costs associated with producing the records you seek is prepared. The tracking number associated with your request is in the subject line of this email. If you have any questions, please let me know. Your request was received in this office on 2/26/2024 and given the reference number P113719-022624 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, s. 286.011, F.S., I hereby request the following records:

Within the time frame of 2019-2024, to be on the date this request is processed, I request the following according to the below criteria:

1. Any opinion issued that mentions or includes the keywords "partial administration" or "partial medication administration" either as a formal opinion or other formal document specific to Registered Nurses.
2. Any an email sent by the person or person(s) with the authority to opine and clarify nuances and specificity referring specifically to RN scope of practice such as by the DON, ADON, CNO (if an available position at your agency), or a similar high-ranking nursing professional of a different title OR non-nursing professional if such person(s) exist that can issue authoritative opinions on the matter, whichever appropriate person(s) exist within your agency. If specificity is required for this criterion, please refer to the keywords above. I'm aware of the ANA Scope of Practice and it does not opine on partial administrations with any degree of specificity or nuance. I request emails where such person(s) are either sender, recipient, cc, or bcc, but please exclude baileypillon@gmail dot com as sender and/or recipient in the responsive records unless noted in a response (I apologize in advance) to this email.
3. Regarding (1) and (2), I request to know the specific contexts in which a partial medication administration is permissible, if at all, and if it is specific to the setting, if it is the case. If so, please specify what contexts it is permissible and when nursing judgment and critical thinking reasonably applies when considering the reasonable, prudent legal standard that RNs are held to.
4. The titles of the person(s) that typically work on EMR/EHRs and the percentage of those persons who are medical professionals that hold an active license from 2019-2024, if it is known to our agency. Please breakdown by year, if possible.
5. If there is a differentiation regarding partial administrations (assuming it is within scope at all) between RNs and LPNs and if it varies depending on the setting and/or context within this specific criterion (5).
6. If a partial medication administration is indeed within the scope of practice within RNs, I wish to know in what manner a healthcare facility may limit or entirely restrict partial administrations, if instructed nursing leadership or noted in the facility policies/procedures.
7. The precise policies/procedures taken by your agency in the event that legal action (in the form of a civil or criminal suit specifically by your agency) is taken against a licensed nursing or other medical professional, including the titles of the person(s) involved.
8. Any documents, if it is the case that a rare, one time partial administration is not within the scope of practice for RNs, that state the rationale as to why it is not within scope according to your agency.
9. Any documents or opinions issued by your agency that set forth an opinion, guidelines, or other type of document wherein there is a clinical disagreement between the RN and MD/DO/ARNP/PA regarding an order, according to clinical judgment, if it conflicts between the RN and provider.
10. Any documents wherein a non-nursing medical professional (specifically an MD/DO) can decide (and if it is legal) what is or isn't within the scope of practice for an RN, given that the provider is not an RN.

If responsive records for the above criteria exceed 200 records, please provide the number of responsive records by each criterion so that I can narrow the scope and/or time frame of this request. I sincerely appreciate it.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge and such documents made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I grant permission for fees up to $50. If the fees are still in excess of $50, please let me know as well as the number of results produced and I will further revise the criteria. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

If you deny any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you think justifies your refusal to release the information and notify me of appeal procedures available under the law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days. Please provide an estimated completion date for the above responsive records.

Sincerely,

Bailey Pillon RN

Michael Faulkner

communications.subject: Re: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Vehicle Pursuit Dashcam video and body camera (Douglas County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

We charge $18.78 pro-rated hourly. The 1st 15 minutes are free, and if the video is available for release our IT Team will have to pull the dash and body cam footage at their rate of $33.61 pro-rated hourly. The 1st 15 minutes are free. Please be advised that this is going to take a considerable amount of research, and If a case is pending prosecution, we will not be able to produce body or dash cam as mandated by O.C.G.A. 50-18-72 (a)(4) of the Georgia Open Records Act. Please let me know how you would like to proceed, and I will obtain a projected estimate that will need to be paid before proceeding. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to me.

Sincerely,

Jillian Ridge
DCSO Record Coordinator
8470 Earl D. Lee Blvd.
Douglasville, Ga. 30134
(770) 920-7140

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Vehicle Pursuit Dashcam video and body camera (Georgia State Patrol)
communications.communication:
Good day,

We are in receipt of your open records request.  DPS will seek reimbursement for reasonable fees pursuant to our charging chart and consistent with Georgia law.  For fee information, please see O.C.G.A. §50-18-71.  You may review our charging chart at https://dps.georgia.gov/charging-fees-open-records-requests.  If the costs exceed $25.00, we will wait for your agreement to pay the estimated costs before completing the request.  Please see O.C.G.A. §50-18-71(d).

Generally, our requestors seek dashcam videos for known events, including citations, crashes, incidents, and arrests.  At a minimum, the requestor provides the name of the subject person, which allows us to pull associated reports to locate any dashcam video.  Even then, dashcam video is not releasable if there are citations issued, if an arrest has been made or if there is a pending investigation which is usually the case for pursuits.  Please see O.C.G.A. 50-18-72(a)(4).  When an investigation is pending, the requestor is tasked with providing either a criminal disposition sheet, a Judge’s Order, or the respective prosecutor’s written authorization before we may release the dashcam video.

If you request all GSP pursuits without a timeframe, we will have to go through hours of video footage without knowing the names of subjects involved and without being able to match those names to citations, crash, incident, or arrest reports.  Then we will have to determine which videos were releasable.  It will be an extremely costly and time-consuming task.

Please consider narrowing your request.  If you have a specific video that you want to request, please advise so we may assist.

Thank you,


Patience Patterson
Project Data Analyst
Georgia Department of Public Safety
Legal Services Department
959 E. United Ave.
Atlanta, GA 30316
Open Records main line: 404-624- 7591
Fax: 404-624-7529
openrecords@gsp.net
